subject: Re: j2me unit testing
msgSnippet: ... This ... the ... Yes, we can. Y see I thought J2MEUnit for testing midlets. But I guess it s for testing classes that midlets use. So the real difference
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Brian Button <bbutton01@e...> wrote:
>
> Once I split out the business logic, J2MEUnit just worked for us.
This
> includes the text version as well as the GUI version. Can you test
the
> non-MIDlet logic through J2MEUnit?

Yes, we can. Y'see I thought J2MEUnit for testing midlets. But I
guess it's for testing classes that midlets use. So the real
difference between JUnit and J2MEUnit is if there is, for example, a
method adding two floats in a Calculator class, JUnit will pass the
test and J2MEUnit will fail (or throw an error).

So J2MEUnit accounts for the differences between the paired-down J2ME
and the regular J2SE?

Thanks for your very simple solution to our problem!

dq
